curam.util.audit

Class DisabledAudit

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.audit.DisabledAudit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuditLogInterface

    public class DisabledAudit
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuditLogInterface
    This class can be used to disable audit information and ensure it is not produced. This class should not be invoked directly - it is called by Audit.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface curam.util.audit.AuditLogInterface

        AuditLogInterface.OperationType

    • Method Detail

      • auditMethodCall

        public void auditMethodCall(DateTime timeStamp,
                            java.lang.String userId,
                            java.lang.String programName,
                            TransactionInfo.TransactionType tranType)
        This method is simply a stubbed version of the Audit Call. It does nothing as it exists simply to ensure the audit information is not produced.
        Specified by:
        auditMethodCall in interface AuditLogInterface
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - The time at which the method was invoked.
        userId - The user who invoked the method.
        programName - The signature of the method which was invoked.
        tranType - The "enumerated type" that indicates the transaction type that is in progress.

      • auditDataAccessCall

        public void auditDataAccessCall(DateTime timeStamp,
                                java.lang.String userId,
                                java.lang.String programName,
                                TransactionInfo.TransactionType tranType,
                                java.lang.String tableName,
                                java.lang.String keyRepresentation,
                                java.lang.String beforeRepresentation,
                                java.lang.String afterRepresentation,
                                AuditLogInterface.OperationType operationType)
        This method is simply a stubbed version of the Audit Call. It does nothing as it exists simply to ensure the audit information is not produced.
        Specified by:
        auditDataAccessCall in interface AuditLogInterface
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - The time at which the database operation was invoked.
        userId - The user who invoked the database operation.
        programName - The signature of the database operation which was invoked.
        tranType - The context in which the method was invoked. This may be one of batch, online, deferred and other.
        tableName - The name of the table that is being audited.
        keyRepresentation - An XML representation of the key that was used as part of the update operation.
        beforeRepresentation - An XML representation of the the values of the various fields before they were updated as part of a data access. This may be an empty string.
        afterRepresentation - An XML representation of the values of the various fields as they will be after they are updated as part of a data access.
        operationType - The operation type that caused the audit record to be produced.
